publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3041# Rhona Brankin: Scottish Mining Museum-That the Parliament recognises the importance of the industrial museum sector and, with the closure of the last deep mine in Scotland at Longannet, the crucial role played by the Scottish Mining Museum at Newtongrange in preserving the heritage of former coal mining communities.

S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Margaret Jamieson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr John McAllion*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Karen Gillon*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Des McNulty*, Rhoda Grant*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Johann Lamont*, Pauline McNeill*, Trish Godman*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Butler*, Michael Matheson*, Kate Maclean*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Tavish Scott*, Phil Gallie*

S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Angus MacKay*, Stewart Stevenson*, Cathie Craigie*, Irene Oldfather*, Elaine Thomson*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Alex Neil*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Murdo Fraser*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Janis Hughes*, Donald Gorrie*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Ian Jenkins*
S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Susan Deacon*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*
S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Shona Robison*
S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-3041# Scottish Mining Museum (lodged on 26 April 2002) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
